titles.title: Providing for further consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 22) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

Providing for further consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 22) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-326, by Mr. Woodall.
Resolution provides for consideration of further amendments to the Senate amendments to H.R. 22.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 72.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 512.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 512, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question, and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question until a time to be announced.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 241 - 183 (Roll no. 597).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 243 - 183 (Roll no. 598).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

ORDER OF BUSINESS - Mr. Woodall asked unanimous consent that during further consideration of the Senate amendments to H.R. 22, pursuant to H.Res. 512, amendment number 23 printed in part B of House Report 114-326 may be considered as though printed immediately following amendment number 9 in part B of such report. Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 22 (Developing a Reliable and Innovative Vision for the Economy Act [DRIVE Act]).
